cat

Once upon a time, I had a cat, I had ten dollars, I would buy it food for eight dollars, bathe it often, and it was very sticky to me.

Later, I took it out to play, passers-by thought it was cute, they fed it cat food, ham sausage, I was very unhappy because it was mine. I wanted to carry it home, but he broke away from me and meowed at the person who gave it good food, I hugged him a few times and he didn't go with me, and scratched me, so I turned around and left.....

Later, I came across it by chance on the road, and it was dirty. Passers-by will only give it good food and play with it, but they will not take it home and bathe it. It saw me and followed me home, I shut it out, it meowed outside the door, it was very uncomfortable,
but I wouldn't want it anymore
.

To quote a story:

Friends

Once, I have a friend, we are very close confidant, sharing each other's joys and sorrows, to share countless happy and sad times. I paid countless efforts and money for him, poured out my enthusiasm and love. But just when I thought our friendship was like dewdrops on a green leaf, crystal clear and eternal, he suddenly left me alone to suffer endless pain and loss.

Time flies, time flies. In this long wait, I finally found my own happiness. He, however, is in his own world more and more deep, day by day towards destruction. When he appeared before me again and asked me to forgive him and make up with him. I no longer have the original vision and expectation.

Because in my opinion, he is no longer worthy of my trust and reliance. His betrayal and hurt have been so deeply imprinted in my heart that I can no longer open my heart to him. I know he's in a bad situation, but that's no reason to forgive him. Because in this world, no one is worth our own fatigue and pain in exchange for others' gratitude and reward.

I refused his request without any remorse in my heart. Because I know it's what he deserves.

Imagine what is worse, the players or the developers. You're delusional if you believe this game is any fun. I managed to get my life settled and move on in the real world that only OW could have made me do. Solo players in this game are destined to lose, developers cut corners doing simple balance changes that ruin the game, they also cash grab with skins that only Valorant level stupid players buy, took away loot boxes, and failed their promises. Kys please if you still play this transgender loving trash game.

Edit: The porn is great I have saved so much money from real women by masturbating to Witch Mercy, D.Va and especially WIDOWMAKER.

The "Not Recommended" for Overwatch 2 comes from a place of genuine love. It is a game that has taken many hours of my life, some of it great, some of it not so much.

This isn't a Marxist rant about the foibles of capitalism or to eat the rich. However, corporate greed has seeped into a well-loved piece of art. Their desire sell you half the product for double the price has ruined the integrity of what the game is supposed to represent. The rise of Battle Passes in all of modern gaming, not just Overwatch, taints the experience for everyone. Heroes, the coolest part of the game, are locked behind Battle Passes or unrealistic grinds for people who have real lives.

The promise of PvE was OverPromised. First day so far, it seems like a good time. But it wasn't what the community had in mind. The expectations were so large that, when they fell short, they decided to lie instead of let the community down gently. Game devs were practically forced to not disclose the reality of the situation lest they face lawsuit that no single person could dare win against.

The predatory practice of Battle Passes taints both Hero releases and the PvE. You know, the fun part of the game. There are a lot of games that are more worth your time and money than just Overwatch 2, and this is coming from the guy that is still playing it. I would actually prefer to be a pure financial supporter without this Battle Pass or paid cosmetic BS.

Do not play Overwatch alone. It is a team-based shooter that punishes you for the mistakes of others. Knowing that fact alone can make you seethe and rage. Blaming your teammates is never right, but it is easier to NOT flame your friends. Even if it is someone's fault, you would have a more fun time playing with your homie and keep each other accountable for mistakes.

The state of various overpowered low-skill, or cheese characters, leads to an unfun situation for lower ranks and unviable characters in higher ranks. No, I don't think the Plat and below players enjoy feeding to Torbjorn, Moira, Brigitte, Symmetra when they just want to try and pick up Genji or Tracer. They want to appeal to a casual audience, but these characters do not encourage people to grow and become stronger. These "chips and soda" Heroes let you win one game at the expense of your growth and enjoyment. The most fun part about Overwatch is improving with a character. The cheese . . . tests your willpower.

The three archetypes are Zoner, Brawler, Diver. In a general sense, Zoners gun down Brawlers before they get close, Diver jump on isolated Zoners controlling space alone, and Brawlers push out Divers with superior health and damage as they both in CQC (close quarters combat). The flaw is letting Brawlers taint the Damage role. I don't know a way to make a high mechanical skill Brawler Damage, but they haven't done it yet. They did a great job with Junker Queen, but Tanks are inherently Brawler archetypes with high HP and reduced range.

The mismanagement of Overwatch League is the result of that same corporate greed. Instead of letting the competitive scene grow organically, they brute forced getting their slice of the pie monopolized. Unfortunately, the low-skill cheese of multiple Brawlers resulted in GOATS meta for a seriously long period of time. Look at CS:GO, Valorant, and similar. Their viewership is insane, and why? Man shoot gun real good. Tracer? Woman move good. Genji? Ninja dash good. So no, people don't enjoy watching Brigitte get slaps through double shield comp while the Mei Ice Blocks so she can't be shot.

Post-GOATS via Role Queue resulted in attempts at its easy success via multiple Brawlers, inevitably resulting in the team comp known as (Brawler) Rush. Candy is fine to eat, but it isn't good to eat every day. Unhealthy metas push viewership down. People don't pop off when their favorite Reaper player blasts shotguns, Wraiths out, and lets the team take care of it. Reinhardt is fine because, again, Tanks are Brawlers inherent. Moira is the worst offender of all. Not every character has to be about sick aim and movement, but Moira turns Brig's "not losing" into punishing new players for not being good enough.

If you made it this far, I'm not saying to not play the game or the game is bad. See if it is for you, but don't fall for the false promises and sleazy practices the company makes to turn your love into a quick buck. You deserve better.
I am not putting any more hours into this game.
best PVE, 3 year waiting and this is what they have

At this point you should already know but this game is trash. It's Overwatch 1 but worse, they only care about the money and will try to charge you tons of money for old skins or "new" skins in the game without mentioning the horrible battle pass. Just play something else and don't waste your time with this.

cat

Once upon a time, I had a cat, I had ten dollars, I would buy it food for eight dollars, bathe it often, and it was very sticky to me.

Later, I took it out to play, passers-by thought it was cute, they fed it cat food, ham sausage, I was very unhappy because it was mine. I wanted to carry it home, but he broke away from me and meowed at the person who gave it good food, I hugged him a few times and he didn't go with me, and scratched me, so I turned around and left.....

Later, I came across it by chance on the road, and it was dirty. Passers-by will only give it good food and play with it, but they will not take it home and bathe it. It saw me and followed me home, I shut it out, it meowed outside the door, it was very uncomfortable,
but I wouldn't want it anymore
.

Once hailed as a groundbreaking sequel to the original Overwatch, anticipation for Overwatch 2 reached a fever pitch among fans and gamers alike. The promise of updated graphics, new heroes, and innovative gameplay mechanics had players eagerly awaiting its release. However, when Overwatch 2 finally hit the shelves, the initial excitement quickly transformed into disappointment.

The game's visuals, touted as a major improvement, fell flat. Players were met with unpolished textures, choppy animations, and numerous graphical glitches that rendered the experience visually unappealing. Characters that were meant to look more detailed ended up resembling awkward caricatures, leaving fans longing for the clean and distinctive art style of the first game.

But the problems didn't stop at the visuals. Overwatch 2 suffered from severe balance issues, with new heroes introduced to the roster that were shockingly overpowered. Players found themselves facing an insurmountable disadvantage when pitted against these new characters, leading to frustration and a feeling of helplessness. The lack of proper testing and fine-tuning was evident, as matches often devolved into chaotic and one-sided battles.

Moreover, the gameplay changes that were promised only served to alienate long-time fans. The core mechanics that had made Overwatch enjoyable were altered in ways that fundamentally changed the feel of the game. Abilities that were once impactful were now mere shadows of their former selves, and the introduction of convoluted new mechanics only added to the confusion. The game lost its identity, leaving players yearning for the days when it was simpler and more engaging.

The single-player campaign, which had been touted as a major selling point, turned out to be a lackluster experience. The story was disjointed and riddled with plot holes, leaving players struggling to connect with the characters and their motivations. The missions lacked variety, often feeling repetitive and uninspired. The once-rich lore of Overwatch was squandered, leaving fans who had invested in the universe feeling betrayed.

As weeks turned into months, the community's frustration grew louder. Social media platforms were flooded with posts detailing the myriad issues with Overwatch 2, and players began to voice their concerns with the hashtag #FixOverwatch2. The developers attempted to address some of the problems through patches, but the changes often created new problems or were simply inadequate to address the underlying issues.

Ultimately, Overwatch 2 became a cautionary tale of the perils of rushed development and neglecting player feedback. The game that was meant to build upon the success of its predecessor ended up tarnishing the franchise's reputation. Long-time fans mourned the loss of what had once been a beloved game, and the gaming community as a whole couldn't help but feel disappointed by what had transpired.

Overwatch 2 stands as a reminder that even the most promising of sequels can falter when the developers lose sight of the elements that made the original great. It's a story of missed opportunities, broken promises, and a community left to grapple with the aftermath of a disappointing release.
